***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

*For the skill, see [Armour (skill)](/Armour_\(skill\) "Armour (skill)").*

|   |                                                                                                                        |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Nought can Deform the Human race Like to the Armours iron brace"-William Blake, "Auguries of Innocence", 99-100. 1803. |

**Armour** encompasses all equipment worn to protect against attacks. Armour increases your [armour class](/Armour_class "Armour class") (AC), which defends against melee, ranged, and most magical attacks. It can also have [egos](/Ego "Ego"), which provide further benefit.

However, [body armour](/Body_armour "Body armour") is [encumbering](/Encumbrance "Encumbrance"). Wearing heavier body armour will lower your [EV](/EV "EV") and [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth"), increase chance of [spell failure](/Spell_failure "Spell failure"), and slow down [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons"). These penalties are reduced, but not eliminated, by [strength](/Strength "Strength") and [Armour skill](/Armour_skill "Armour skill"). Only body armour and [shields](/Shield "Shield") have encumbrance penalties; all other armour can be worn at no cost.

[Shields](/Shield "Shield") increase [SH](/SH "SH") instead of AC, but are usually considered a piece of "armour" as well.

## Armour Locations

There are six armour locations in *Crawl*, also known as **armour slots**. Some [species](/Species "Species") have restrictions on the kinds of armour they can wear, while many [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations") will render pieces unusable.

- **[Body armour](/Body_armour "Body armour")** is worn on a character's torso, and is the primary source of AC. Its AC bonus is penalized by the [Deformed](/Deformed "Deformed") mutation. Heavier body armour imposes greater penalties.
- **[Gloves](/Gloves "Gloves")** are worn on the hands, and are unusable with rank 3 of the [Claws](/Claws "Claws") mutation.
- **[Boots](/Boots "Boots")** are worn on the feet, and are unusable with rank 3 of either the [Talons](/Talons "Talons") or [Hooves](/Hooves "Hooves") mutations.
  - In place of boots, [Armataurs](/Armataur "Armataur") and [Nagas](/Naga "Naga") can wear **[bardings](/Barding "Barding")** on the rear portions of their bodies. They provide more AC and higher potential enchantment, but slightly reduce your [EV](/EV "EV").
- **[Helmets](/Helmet "Helmet")** and **[hats](/Hat "Hat")** are worn on the head. The [Beak](/Beak "Beak"), [Antennae](/Antennae "Antennae"), and [Horns](/Horns "Horns") mutations all restrict the player's headgear options.
- **[Cloaks](/Cloak "Cloak")** and **[scarves](/Scarf "Scarf")** are worn around the shoulders, which are unusable with demonspawn's [Weakening Stinger](/Weakening_Stinger "Weakening Stinger").
- **[Shields](/Shields "Shields")** and **[orbs](/Orb "Orb")** are held on character's arm. They prevent the use of [two-handed](/Handedness "Handedness") weapons. Shields provide [SH](/SH "SH"), but impede spellcasting and EV without sufficient skill.

All armour types, including shields, take 5 turns to remove and 5 turns to put on. If you swap from one piece of armour to another, it takes 10 turns total. If you are hurt when (un)equpping armour, the game will ask if you want to abort the action.

## Encumbrance Rating

Most [body armour](/Body_armour "Body armour") has an [encumbrance rating](/Encumbrance_rating "Encumbrance rating") proportional to its AC. [Robes](/Robe "Robe") and [leather armour](/Leather_armour "Leather armour"), being lightweight, have little or no EV penalty; at the other end of the spectrum you can find [plate armour](/Plate_armour "Plate armour") and [crystal plate armour](/Crystal_plate_armour "Crystal plate armour"), which are cumbersome but incredibly protective.

A higher [encumbrance rating](/Encumbrance_rating "Encumbrance rating"):

- Lowers your [evasion](/Ev "Ev")
- Makes you less [stealthy](/Stealth "Stealth")
- Reduces your spellcasting success rate
- Make [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons") attack slower (not including [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") weapons)

Increasing your Armour skill decreases the effect of the encumbrance rating (-2.2% per level, or -60% at Armour 27) and boosts the total AC granted by those pieces. High [strength](/Strength "Strength") will also help. Stealth is always penalized the same. See the [encumbrance rating](/Encumbrance_rating "Encumbrance rating") page for more details.

[Shields](/Shield "Shield") have an encumbrance rating, but it works differently from body armour. See [Shields](/Shields "Shields") for more details.

Only body armour and shields have an encumbrance rating. [Bardings](/Barding "Barding") have an EV penalty, but this is unrelated to ER.

## Calculating AC Value

### Base AC & Armour skill

Your total "base AC" is equal to the *sum* of the base AC values from every worn armour. This excludes any armour [enchantments](/Enchant "Enchant") you may have.

Then, [Armour skill](/Armour_skill "Armour skill") provides a bonus to AC, using your base AC:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

```
  (base AC) * (1 + Armour_skill / 22)
```

This is roughly equivalent to +4.5% base AC per level of Armour skill. AC is calculated to 2 decimal places, and most displays show this value rounded down. Item descriptions will, however, show your AC rounded to 1 decimal place, together with the change in AC from equipping or removing that item.

### Body Armour Penalties

There are two penalties that lower your body armour's base AC. These are calculated after the bonus from Armour skill. These do not impact enchantment or other armour types.

- If you have the [Deformed](/Deformed "Deformed") or the [Pseudopods](/Pseudopods "Pseudopods") mutation, you lose `<body armour base AC> * 0.5` AC. These mutations do not stack with each other.
- If you are in [Blade Form](/Blade_Form "Blade Form") and under 19 [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting") skill, you lose `<body armour base AC> * (19 - Shapeshifting) / 9` AC. This cannot be greater than your body armour base AC.

If both penalties apply, they stack multiplicatively, for a total loss of `(1 - <body armour base AC>) * 0.5 * <Blade Hands Modifier>` AC.

### Bonuses

All other sources of AC are flat, additive bonuses to your AC score, which are not impacted by armour or Armour skill:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- Value from armour [enchantment](/Enchant "Enchant"), [rings of protection](/Rings_of_protection "Rings of protection"), and [artefact](/Artefact "Artefact") bonuses
- [Ozocubu's Armour](/Ozocubu%27s_Armour "Ozocubu's Armour")
- [Protection](/Protection "Protection") brand
- [Mutations](/Mutation "Mutation")
- Innate AC from [transformations](/Transformation "Transformation"), like [Dragon Form](/Dragon_Form "Dragon Form") and [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form")

## Egos

Enchanted armour may have an [ego](/Ego "Ego"), which gives it additional properties.

## Restrictions and Mutations

- Beaks, horns, and antennae are incompatible with helmets. Hats are allowed.
  - Horns 3 and Antennae 3 disallow all headgear, however.
- Hooves 3 and talons 3 are incompatible with boots.
- Claws 3 and [Blade Hands](/Blade_Hands "Blade Hands") are incompatible with gloves.
  - Blade Hands is in addition incompatible with all types of shields and weapons.
- Weakening stinger is incompatible with cloaks.
- [Wisp Form](/Wisp_Form "Wisp Form") is incompatible with all armour and jewellery.
- [Bat Form](/Bat_Form "Bat Form") and [Pig Form](/Pig_Form "Pig Form") are incompatible with all armour and rings (you can only wear amulets).
- [Fungus Form](/Fungus_Form "Fungus Form"), [Spider Form](/Spider_Form "Spider Form"), [Ice Form](/Ice_Form "Ice Form"), [Storm Form](/Storm_Form "Storm Form"), and [Dragon Form](/Dragon_Form "Dragon Form") are incompatible with all armour (you can only wear jewellery).
- [Tree Form](/Tree_Form "Tree Form") is incompatible with all armour except shields.
- [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form") is incompatible with all armour except headgear, shields, and cloaks.

## History

- Prior to [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), AC was always rounded down to an integer, meaning AC would increase at specific breakpoints in Armour skill, rather than increasing smoothly.
- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), body armour encumbrance did *not* slow down [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons").
- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), armour and shields would penalize your [to-hit](/To-hit "To-hit").
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), [GDR](/GDR "GDR") was determined based on your body armour, not from total [AC](/AC "AC").
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), heavy armour slowed [throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") and [unarmed combat](/Unarmed_combat "Unarmed combat") attacks.
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), light armour had no small spellcasting success penalty.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), armour took `AC + 1` turns to unequip or equip (instead of a flat 5 turns).
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), [racial armour types](/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment") existed. Elven armour impeded spellcasting less, dwarven armour had more AC but impeded casting more, and orcish armour was better for [Hill Orcs](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc") only.
- In [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), the evasion penalty system was changed. "Base Evasion Penalty" (BEVP) was changed into [encumbrance rating](/Encumbrance_rating "Encumbrance rating"), and rescaled for all armours (see [dev wiki](https://crawl.develz.org/wiki/doku.php?id=dcss:brainstorm:mutation:stats\&#effect_of_strength_on_armour_evp)).
- Prior to [0.11](/0.11 "0.11"), you could only train Armour while wearing equipment with an EV penalty of at least -1.
- Prior to [0.6](/0.6 "0.6"), body armour was divided into "Light Armour" and "Heavy Armour". The former would allow you to train Dodging, while the latter trained Armour.

### Changes to armour types

- In [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), [chain mail](/Chain_mail "Chain mail") had encumbrance reduced (from 15 -> 14).
- In [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), [shadow dragon scales](/Shadow_dragon_scales "Shadow dragon scales") had its AC increased (10 -> 11).
- Orbs were introduced in [0.28](/0.28 "0.28").
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), bardings were split into [naga bardings](/Naga_barding "Naga barding") and [centaur bardings](/Centaur_barding "Centaur barding").
- Scarves were added in [0.20](/0.20 "0.20").
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), dragon scales were named dragon armours. Also, trolls/dragons only dropped hides; you had to use a [scroll of enchant armour](/Scroll_of_enchant_armour "Scroll of enchant armour") on the hide to get the armour.
- In [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), [scale mail](/Scale_mail "Scale mail") had encumbrance reduced (11 -> 10).
- In [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), gold dragon armour, crystal plate armour, and plate armour have had their encumbrance ratings reduced (27 -> 25, 24 -> 23, and 19 -> 18 respectively). Mottled dragon armour increased ER from 4 to 5.
- In [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), [splint mail](/Splint_mail "Splint mail") was removed.

Armour Locations

There are six armour locations in Crawl, also known as armour slots. Some species have restrictions on the kinds of armour they can wear, while many Transmutations will render pieces unusable.

  • Body armour is worn on a character's torso, and is the primary source of AC. Its AC bonus is penalized by the Deformed mutation. Heavier body armour imposes greater penalties.
  • Gloves are worn on the hands, and are unusable with rank 3 of the Claws mutation.
  • Boots are worn on the feet, and are unusable with rank 3 of either the Talons or Hooves mutations.
    • In place of boots, Armataurs and Nagas can wear bardings on the rear portions of their bodies. They provide more AC and higher potential enchantment, but slightly reduce your EV.
  • Helmets and hats are worn on the head. The Beak, Antennae, and Horns mutations all restrict the player's headgear options.
  • Cloaks and scarves are worn around the shoulders, which are unusable with demonspawn's Weakening Stinger.
  • Shields and orbs are held on character's arm. They prevent the use of two-handed weapons. Shields provide SH, but impede spellcasting and EV without sufficient skill.

All armour types, including shields, take 5 turns to remove and 5 turns to put on. If you swap from one piece of armour to another, it takes 10 turns total. If you are hurt when (un)equpping armour, the game will ask if you want to abort the action.

A higher encumbrance rating:

  • Makes you less stealthy
  • Reduces your spellcasting success rate
  • Make Ranged Weapons attack slower (not including Throwing weapons)

Increasing your Armour skill decreases the effect of the encumbrance rating (-2.2% per level, or -60% at Armour 27) and boosts the total AC granted by those pieces. High strength will also help. Stealth is always penalized the same. See the encumbrance rating page for more details.

Shields have an encumbrance rating, but it works differently from body armour. See Shields for more details.

Only body armour and shields have an encumbrance rating. Bardings have an EV penalty, but this is unrelated to ER.

  • If you have the Deformed or the Pseudopods mutation, you lose <body armour base AC> * 0.5 AC. These mutations do not stack with each other.
  • If you are in Blade Form and under 19 Shapeshifting skill, you lose <body armour base AC> * (19 - Shapeshifting) / 9 AC. This cannot be greater than your body armour base AC.

If both penalties apply, they stack multiplicatively, for a total loss of (1 - <body armour base AC>) * 0.5 * <Blade Hands Modifier> AC.

Bonuses

All other sources of AC are flat, additive bonuses to your AC score, which are not impacted by armour or Armour skill:[2]

  • Value from armour enchantment, rings of protection, and artefact bonuses
  • Ozocubu's Armour
  • Protection brand
  • Mutations
  • Innate AC from transformations, like Dragon Form and Statue Form

{{version032}} ''For the skill, see [[Armour (skill)]].'' {{flavour|Nought can Deform the Human race
Like to the Armours iron brace" -William Blake, "Auguries of Innocence", 99-100. 1803.}} '''Armour''' encompasses all equipment worn to protect against attacks. Armour increases your [[armour class]] (AC), which defends against melee, ranged, and most magical attacks. It can also have [[ego]]s, which provide further benefit. However, [[body armour]] is [[encumbrance|encumbering]]. Wearing heavier body armour will lower your [[EV]] and [[stealth]], increase chance of [[spell failure]], and slow down [[Ranged Weapons]]. These penalties are reduced, but not eliminated, by [[strength]] and [[Armour skill]]. Only body armour and [[shield]]s have encumbrance penalties; all other armour can be worn at no cost. [[Shield]]s increase [[SH]] instead of AC, but are usually considered a piece of "armour" as well. ==Armour Locations== There are six armour locations in ''Crawl'', also known as '''armour slots'''. Some [[species]] have restrictions on the kinds of armour they can wear, while many [[Transmutations]] will render pieces unusable. *'''[[Body armour]]''' is worn on a character's torso, and is the primary source of AC. Its AC bonus is penalized by the [[Deformed]] mutation. Heavier body armour imposes greater penalties. *'''[[Gloves]]''' are worn on the hands, and are unusable with rank 3 of the [[Claws]] mutation. *'''[[Boots]]''' are worn on the feet, and are unusable with rank 3 of either the [[Talons]] or [[Hooves]] mutations. **In place of boots, [[Armataur]]s and [[Naga]]s can wear '''[[barding]]s''' on the rear portions of their bodies. They provide more AC and higher potential enchantment, but slightly reduce your [[EV]]. *'''[[Helmet]]s''' and '''[[hat]]s''' are worn on the head. The [[Beak]], [[Antennae]], and [[Horns]] mutations all restrict the player's headgear options. *'''[[Cloak]]s''' and '''[[Scarf|scarves]]''' are worn around the shoulders, which are unusable with demonspawn's [[Weakening Stinger]]. *'''[[Shields]]''' and '''[[orb]]s''' are held on character's arm. They prevent the use of [[Handedness|two-handed]] weapons. Shields provide [[SH]], but impede spellcasting and EV without sufficient skill. All armour types, including shields, take 5 turns to remove and 5 turns to put on. If you swap from one piece of armour to another, it takes 10 turns total. If you are hurt when (un)equpping armour, the game will ask if you want to abort the action. ==Encumbrance Rating== Most [[body armour]] has an [[encumbrance rating]] proportional to its AC. [[Robe]]s and [[leather armour]], being lightweight, have little or no EV penalty; at the other end of the spectrum you can find [[plate armour]] and [[crystal plate armour]], which are cumbersome but incredibly protective. A higher [[encumbrance rating]]: *Lowers your [[ev]]asion *Makes you less [[stealth]]y *Reduces your spellcasting success rate *Make [[Ranged Weapons]] attack slower (not including [[Throwing]] weapons) Increasing your Armour skill decreases the effect of the encumbrance rating (-2.2% per level, or -60% at Armour 27) and boosts the total AC granted by those pieces. High [[strength]] will also help. Stealth is always penalized the same. See the [[encumbrance rating]] page for more details. [[Shield]]s have an encumbrance rating, but it works differently from body armour. See [[Shields]] for more details. Only body armour and shields have an encumbrance rating. [[Barding]]s have an EV penalty, but this is unrelated to ER. ==Calculating AC Value== ===Base AC & Armour skill=== Your total "base AC" is equal to the ''sum'' of the base AC values from every worn armour. This excludes any armour [[enchant]]ments you may have. Then, [[Armour skill]] provides a bonus to AC, using your base AC:{{source ref|0.28.0|player.cc|5691}} (base AC) * (1 + Armour_skill / 22) This is roughly equivalent to +4.5% base AC per level of Armour skill. AC is calculated to 2 decimal places, and most displays show this value rounded down. Item descriptions will, however, show your AC rounded to 1 decimal place, together with the change in AC from equipping or removing that item. ===Body Armour Penalties=== There are two penalties that lower your body armour's base AC. These are calculated after the bonus from Armour skill. These do not impact enchantment or other armour types. *If you have the [[Deformed]] or the [[Pseudopods]] mutation, you lose * 0.5 AC. These mutations do not stack with each other. *If you are in [[Blade Form]] and under 19 [[Shapeshifting]] skill, you lose * (19 - Shapeshifting) / 9 AC. This cannot be greater than your body armour base AC. If both penalties apply, they stack multiplicatively, for a total loss of (1 - ) * 0.5 * AC. ===Bonuses=== All other sources of AC are flat, additive bonuses to your AC score, which are not impacted by armour or Armour skill:{{source ref|0.28.0|player.cc|5914}} *Value from armour [[enchant]]ment, [[rings of protection]], and [[artefact]] bonuses *[[Ozocubu's Armour]] *[[Protection]] brand |align="right" | -6 |align="right" | Naga/Armataur |} ==Egos== Enchanted armour may have an [[ego]], which gives it additional properties. ==Restrictions and Mutations== *Beaks, horns, and antennae are incompatible with helmets. Hats are allowed. **Horns 3 and Antennae 3 disallow all headgear, however. *Hooves 3 and talons 3 are incompatible with boots. *Claws 3 and [[Blade Hands]] are incompatible with gloves. **Blade Hands is in addition incompatible with all types of shields and weapons. *Weakening stinger is incompatible with cloaks. *[[Wisp Form]] is incompatible with all armour and jewellery. *[[Bat Form]] and [[Pig Form]] are incompatible with all armour and rings (you can only wear amulets). *[[Fungus Form]], [[Spider Form]], [[Ice Form]], [[Storm Form]], and [[Dragon Form]] are incompatible with all armour (you can only wear jewellery). *[[Tree Form]] is incompatible with all armour except shields. *[[Statue Form]] is incompatible with all armour except headgear, shields, and cloaks. ==History== *Prior to [[0.32]], AC was always rounded down to an integer, meaning AC would increase at specific breakpoints in Armour skill, rather than increasing smoothly. *Prior to [[0.29]], body armour encumbrance did ''not'' slow down [[Ranged Weapons]]. *Prior to [[0.28]], armour and shields would penalize your [[to-hit]]. *Prior to [[0.27]], [[GDR]] was determined based on your body armour, not from total [[AC]]. *Prior to [[0.17]], heavy armour slowed [[throwing]] and [[unarmed combat]] attacks. *Prior to [[0.16]], light armour had no small spellcasting success penalty. *Prior to [[0.15]], armour took AC + 1 turns to unequip or equip (instead of a flat 5 turns). *Prior to [[0.14]], [[Racial equipment|racial armour types]] existed. Elven armour impeded spellcasting less, dwarven armour had more AC but impeded casting more, and orcish armour was better for [[Hill Orc]]s only. *In [[0.13]], the evasion penalty system was changed. "Base Evasion Penalty" (BEVP) was changed into [[encumbrance rating]], and rescaled for all armours (see [https://crawl.develz.org/wiki/doku.php?id=dcss:brainstorm:mutation:stats&#effect_of_strength_on_armour_evp dev wiki]). *Prior to [[0.11]], you could only train Armour while wearing equipment with an EV penalty of at least -1. *Prior to [[0.6]], body armour was divided into "Light Armour" and "Heavy Armour". The former would allow you to train Dodging, while the latter trained Armour. ===Changes to armour types=== *In [[0.30]], [[chain mail]] had encumbrance reduced (from 15 -> 14). *In [[0.29]], [[shadow dragon scales]] had its AC increased (10 -> 11). *Orbs were introduced in [[0.28]]. *Prior to [[0.26]], bardings were split into [[naga barding]]s and [[centaur barding]]s. *Scarves were added in [[0.20]]. *Prior to [[0.19]], dragon scales were named dragon armours. Also, trolls/dragons only dropped hides; you had to use a [[scroll of enchant armour]] on the hide to get the armour. *In [[0.16]], [[scale mail]] had encumbrance reduced (11 -> 10). *In [[0.14]], gold dragon armour, crystal plate armour, and plate armour have had their encumbrance ratings reduced (27 -> 25, 24 -> 23, and 19 -> 18 respectively). Mottled dragon armour increased ER from 4 to 5. *In [[0.13]], [[splint mail]] was removed. ==References== [[Category:Armours]] {{Skills}}
